declarations.description:
`furo-ui5-context-menu`
 is a context menu or menu element.


 You have to put a `furo-ui5-context-menu-display` element in one of the parent elements of the element where you use the `furo-ui5-context-menu`.
 The app-shell is a good place for that.

```html
 <furo-ui5-context-menu  ƒ-trigger="--menuClkd" ƒ-bind-data="--menuObject" @-menu-item-selected="--menuItem">
     <ui5-icon name="menu" @-click="--menuClkd"></ui5-icon>
 </furo-ui5-context-menu>
```

## Data signature

```yaml
- type: 'menu.Menuitem #Item signature for a context menu'
 fields:
   icon: 'string:1 #Leading icon of the menu'
   display_name: 'string:2 #String representation of the menu item. Menu item text'
   disabled: 'bool:3 #Display actions as disabled when they can only be used sometimes and under certain conditions.'
   command: 'string:4 #Keyboard command hint'
   leading_divider: 'bool:5 #Item has a leading divider line'
   children: '[] menu.Menuitem:6 #Children of this item'
```
declarations.name: FuroUi5ContextMenu

slots.description: default slot to add an individual context menu opener component (e.g. furo-icon-button).

members.name: bindData
members.description: Bind your menu object with the signature of menu.Menuitem or [menu.Menuitem].

members.name: setContext

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.description: Can be anything, will be returned at the menu-item-selected method

members.description: Sets the context. Use this if you want to set a Object as context

members.name: trigger
members.description: Triggers the context menu. Set by keyboard to true to focus the first element for keyboard navigation

members.name: _context
members.description: Use this to set a string value as context.

events.description: Fired when context menu was triggered
events.name: open-furo-ui5-menu-requested

events.description: Fired when a menu item is selected
events.name: menu-item-selected

attributes.name: context
attributes.description: Use this to set a string value as context.
